tit.e: Noryo-yuka (also called as Noryo-doko - breeze-enjoying floor)
tit.cmt: (also called as Noryo-doko - に訂正しました。

sen.j: 納涼床（のうりょうゆか、のうりょうどこ）、あるいは川床（鴨川 (淀川水系)では「かわゆか」、貴船、高雄 (京都市)では「かわどこ」と読むのが一般的）は京都の夏の風物詩の一つである。
sen.e: Noryo-yuka/Noryo-doko or the riverbed (In general, for Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River water system), it is pronounced as "kawayuka"; for Kifune or Takao in Kyoto, it is pronounced as "kawadoko") is one of the poetic scenery in summer of Kyoto.

sen.j: 料理店や茶屋が川の上や、屋外で川のよく見える位置に座敷を作り、料理を提供する。
sen.e: Restaurants or teahouses may set tables and offer cuisines on rivers or outdoors so that a river can be seen well.
Restaurants or teahouses may set tables and offer cuisine near rivers or outdoors so that the river can be seen well.

sen.j: 5月ごろから9月ごろまで、鴨川、貴船、高雄、鷹ヶ峯など京都市内各地で楽しむことができる。
sen.e: From around May to until about September, it is possible to enjoy this in various places in Kyoto city such as Kamogawa, Kibune, Takao, and Takagamine.

sen.j: 二条から五条にかけて90軒ほどの店が並ぶ。
sen.e: From Nijo to Gojo, about 90 restaurants line up.

sen.j: 京料理以外にも中華や焼肉など各国の料理が選べるので、気軽に納涼床を楽しむことができる。
sen.e: Besides Kyo-ryori (local cuisine of Kyoto), because Chinese cuisine and grilled mea can be chosen, one can readily enjoy the breeze-enjoying floor.

sen.j: また、最近では大衆的なチェーン店であるスターバックス京都三条大橋店でも納涼床を楽しむことができ、時代の流れを感じる。
sen.e: Moreover recent, the popular chain cafe Starbucks Coffee has opened the Kyoto-sanjo-ohashi branch with the breeze-enjoying floor. One can feel the flow of era there.

sen.j: 基本的に夜の納涼床が中心であるが、5月・9月は昼の納涼床も楽しめる。
sen.e: Basically, the breeze-enjoying floor is mainly for enjoying the evening cool. But in May or September, one can also enjoy the daytime cool there.
Basically, the breeze-enjoying floor is mainly for enjoying the cool evenings. But in May or September, one can also enjoy the coolness of the daytime as well.

sen.j: （食中毒防止のため、7・8月は昼の納涼床は営業しない。)
sen.e: (For preventing food poisoning, the enjoying the daytime cool floor is not opened for business in July and August.)

sen.j: 貴船口駅から貴船神社に向けて少し歩くと20軒ほどの店が床を並べている。
sen.e: Walking a little bit from Kibuneguchi Station towards Kibune-jinja Shrine, one can find about 20 restaurants displaying the floor.

sen.j: 京料理や流しそうめんを楽しむことができる。
sen.e: One can enjoy Kyo-ryori (Japanese cuisine of Kyoto) and Nagashi-somen (flowing somen noodles).

sen.j: 自然が多く情緒溢れる床である。
sen.e: It is a floor full of nature and overflowed with emotions.
